channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lots of smashed/damaged paving stones, 2nd March
item.description:
The paving stones are situated immediately outside the front of the Queens Hotel at the Montpellier end of the Prom. I suspect that vehicles/coaches are parking half-on/off the double yellow lines which I believe is illegal. There is no other obvious reason as to why so many paving stones are cracked and wobbling.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Imperial Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken ironwork! Whole unit loose. Incredibly loud when cars drive over it., 2nd March
item.description:
In the middle of Lancaster road in the middle of number 30 and 35. It’s been like this for months and seems to be getting louder. The whole unit moves and comes away from the tarmac. It’s a busy road and cars drive over it from 5:40am until midnight.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Road, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Flooded due to block Drains and Drain off Areas., 2nd March
item.description:
The location is the double sharp bends on Mill Lane. Due to the heavy rainfall, the road is / was flooded which seems to be a usual occurance over the years. The water is running down the Public Footpath between Mill Lane and Ham Lane with some running down the ditch alongside the footpath which is where it should be. The drains are blocked and where the drains are suposed to run off to at the top of the Drainage ditch is blocked as well. Please can this be cleared as soon as possible and hopefully future proofed against a re-occurrence
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gulley one third of way from Whitecross Square to Thirlestaine Road, 2nd March
item.description:
The nearest property is 89 Naunton Lane. The blocked gully is a little north of that. Flooding on the corner of Whitecross Square a few years ago resulted in serious damage to property - especially in Whitecross Square. This was the subject of insurance claims amounting to tens of thousands of pounds. The cause was a combination of blocked gullies in the vicinity and additional water in the small brook between Naunton Park Park and properties on the north side of it. This brook aliments the small lakes in the Cheltenham College grounds. The trees in the College grounds on the west side of the lane shed much foliage in the autumn. I suggest that all the gullies in the locality be properly scoured around the turn of the year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thirlestaine Road, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain blocked outside 1 Tivoli Road, 2nd March
item.description:
Drain blocked outside 1 Tivoli Road. Flooding making the pavement impassable. This drain becomes blocked easily and has been an intermittent problem for 7 or 8 years. It needs regular maintenance and doesn't get it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Tivoli Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 2nd March
item.description:
deep potholes more than 120ml deep o/s Manor Cottage but alot of others that fall beneath the intervention level - has not reported any damage to vehicles, Ones o/s the Cottage repaired 3 months ago have now failed. Tried reporting them on line but form advised to call in.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Honeybourne Line - Malvern Road station (site of), 2nd March
item.description:
Surfaced path flooded full width - main path, adjacent to bottom of access ramp leading down from Malvern Road (within remains of railway station platforms). No drainage. Not helped by water running down adjacent access ramp - groundwater comes out of raised ground to South (sports pitches to rear of Ladies College Sports Centre)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Honeybourne Line - under Malvern Road bridge, 2nd March
item.description:
Surfaced footpath flooded full width, directly beneath Malvern Road over-bridge. Happens regularly during / after wet weather - no drainage. ALSO NOTE bricks lying in water on path - suggest urgent inspection needed to brick arch to road bridge.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
